act.title: The Merchant Shipping (Recruitment and Placement of Seafarers) Rules, 20051
act.article:
1 Short title and commencement.—
1 These rules may be called the Merchant Shipping (Recruitment and Placement of Seafarers) Rules, 2005.
2 They shall come into force on the date of their publication in the Official Gazette.

4 Recruitment and placement service licence. —
1 A recruitment and placement service registered in India may apply for a recruitment and placement licence to the seamen's employment office concerned in Form I: Provided that the Director shall examine the report of the inspecting authority and issue the licence on authorisation by the Director-General: Provided further that the Director-General may authorise the Director to issue a licence after any inspection carried out under sub-rule (3) of rule 3.
2 A recruitment and placement service licence and such number of attested copies thereof equal to the number of branch offices of the recruitment and placement service shall be issued in Form II.
3 An application for licence shall be accompanied by—
a a declaration in Form III; b a fee for twenty thousand rupees drawn in favour of the Director concerned by way of crossed demand draft; c a copy of the employment contract entered into between the employer and the seafarer; d a statement of qualification and experience of the management personnel in Form VIII; 1[e a copy of the agreement between the recruitment and placement service and the employer or the ship owner as the case may be, in Form IX;] f such number of bank guarantees as required under sub-rule (12).
4 The contract and the agreement referred to in clause (c) and clause (e) of sub-rule (3) shall make provision for the repatriation of a stranded seafarer, his maintenance and the transportation of the mortal remains of an expired seafarer.
5 A licence shall be issued for a period not exceeding five years.
6 An application for renewal of licence shall be in Form VI and shall be accompanied by—
a declaration in Form III; b a fee of ten thousand rupees in favour of the Director concerned by way of crossed demand draft; c a copy of the employment contract entered into between the employer and the seafarer; d a statement of qualification and experience of the management personnel in Form VIII; 1[e a copy of the agreement between the recruitment and placement service and the employer or the ship owner as the case may be, in Form IX;] f such number of bank guarantees as required under sub-rule (12).
7 The contract and the agreement referred to in clause (c) and clause (e) of sub-rule (6) shall make provision for the repatriation of a stranded seafarer, his maintenance and the transportation of the mortal remains of an expired seafarer.
8 An application for renewal of licence shall be submitted by a recruitment and placement service before three months of the date of expiry of such licence.
9 The licence issued under these rules shall not be transferable.
10 The recruitment and placement service shall, from time to time, intimate the Director any change in the place of business within seven days of such change and apply for a fresh licence on payment of a fee of five thousand rupees in the manner specified in sub-rule (3).
11 The licence shall be prominently displayed at the premises of the recruitment and placement service at a place accessible to public.
12 The bank guarantee referred to in clause (f) of sub-rule (3) or in clause (f) of sub-rule (6) shall be in accordance with the Table below:— 2[TABLE
Sl. No. Number of jobs Amount of bank guarantee in Indian Rupees
1 2 3 4 5 6 upto 50 51 to 250 251 to 500 501 to 750 751 to 1000 1001 and above 5.00 lakhs 7.50 lakhs 10.00 lakhs 12.50 lakhs 15.00 lakhs 20.00 lakhs
13 The bank guarantee shall be drawn in favour of the seamen's employment office, which shall be drawn on a scheduled bank in India.
14 A bank guarantee shall be in the denomination commensurate with the number of jobs and shall be valid at all times.
15 In the event of any change in the number of jobs, the recruitment and placement service may furnish the requisite bank guarantee within a period of one month from the date of such change.
16 Without prejudice to the foregoing sub-rules, the recruitment and placement service shall ensure that a seafarer with whom an employment agreement is entered into is placed on board a ship.
3[17 In the event of any change in the agreement between the recruitment and placement service and the employer or the ship owner, as the case may be, or in the event of any new agreement with any other employer or ship owner, the recruitment and placement service shall, within seven days thereof, intimate the same of the Director along with the copy of the amended agreement, or new agreement, as the case may be.]

6 Suspension or withdrawal of recruitment and placement service licence.—
1 On a report by the inspecting authority or a complaint by a seafarer or otherwise, the Director-General may authorise the Director to issue a notice in Form VII to the recruitment and placement service requiring it to show cause within a period of thirty days from the date of issue of such notice as to why the licence shall not be suspended or withdrawn.
2 The Director-General, after considering the reply to the show-cause notice, shall as soon as possible but not later than thirty days from the date of receipt of reply, if any, authorise the Director to pass such order of suspension or withdrawal as he deems fit and communicate the same to the recruitment and placement service and forward a copy thereof alongwith a detailed report to the Central Government forthwith.
3 Every order passed under sub-rule (2) shall be self-contained and give reasons for the conclusions stated therein for suspension or withdrawal of licence.

7 Appeal.—Any person aggrieved of an order under rule 6 may within thirty days of the date of receipt of such order appeal to the Central Government, which shall pass an order thereon within thirty days from the date of receipt of such appeal.

8 Transitional provision.—Notwithstanding anything contained in the foregoing rules, a person, company, institution, agency or other organization in the public or private sector which is engaged in recruiting seafarers on behalf of employers or placing seafarers with employers may obtain a licence within 6[one year] from the date of commencement of these rules:
Provided that a person, company, institution, agency or other organisation in the public or private sector may continue to function as such till such person, company, institution, agency or other organization obtains a licence under these rules.

The Merchant Shipping (Recruitment and Placement of Seafarers) Rules, 2005
FORM I

[See rule 4(1)]
1. Name

6. Fax Number

8. (a) Registered Office Address
(b) Address of all branches
9. Whether the office is owned/leased/hired
10. Residential address of the authorized signatories
11. Name and address of all the Bankers
12. Permanent income-tax number and GIR No., if applicable (enclose a copy of the previous years’ income-tax returns)
13. Details of Business during the last five years—enclose Profit and Loss Account and Balance sheet
14. Experience, if any, in recruitment of seafarer, number of years
15. Whether any authorised signatory has been associated with any recruiting agency in the past if so, give details
16. If previously in the business of recruitment of seafarers total number of seafarers deployed year-wise, country-wise and category-wise during the last five years
17. Whether there are any complaints pending in respect of seafarers recruited, if so, details thereof
18. Whether there is any criminal or civil case pending in any court. If so, details thereof
19. Whether any authorised signatory has been convicted. If so, details thereof
20. Total number of agreements/contracts with employer with details thereof
21. Number of seafarers proposed to be recruited
22. Other Shipping related activities carried out, if any
Undertaking
I/we undertake that all that are stated above are true and correct to the best of my/our knowledge, information and belief and in the event of any of the information furnished above is found false or incorrect in any respect, I/we shall abide by any decision of the Director, seamen’s employment office.
